## **7.2 Getting Started**



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse, tsibble, feasts, fable, seasonal)
```
:::



### **7.2.1 Importing the data**



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ts_data <- read_csv(
  "visitor_arrivals_by_air.csv")
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ts_data$`Month-Year` <- dmy(
  ts_data$`Month-Year`)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ts_data
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}


### **7.2.3 Conventional base `ts` object versus `tibble` object**



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ts_data_ts <- ts(ts_data)       
head(ts_data_ts)
```

### **7.2.4 Converting `tibble` object to `tsibble` object**



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ts_tsibble <- ts_data %>%
  mutate(Month = yearmonth(`Month-Year`)) %>%
  as_tsibble(index = `Month`)
```
:::



## **7.3 Visualising Time-series Data**



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ts_longer <- ts_data %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = c(2:34),
               names_to = "Country",
               values_to = "Arrivals")
```
:::



### **7.3.1 Visualising single time-series: ggplot2 methods**



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ts_longer %>%
  filter(Country == "Vietnam") %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = `Month-Year`, 
             y = Arrivals))+
  geom_line(size = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex07_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ts_longer %>%
  filter(Country == "Malaysia") %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = `Month-Year`, 
             y = Arrivals))+
  geom_line(size = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex07_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ts_longer %>%
  filter(Country == "Myanmar") %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = `Month-Year`, 
             y = Arrivals))+
  geom_line(size = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex07_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



### **9.3.2 Plotting multiple time-series data with ggplot2 methods**

very hard to see



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = ts_longer, 
       aes(x = `Month-Year`, 
           y = Arrivals,
           color = Country))+
  geom_line(size = 0.5) +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom", 
        legend.box.spacing = unit(0.5, "cm"))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex07_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



In order to provide effective comparison, [`facet_wrap()`](https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/facet_wrap.html) of **ggplot2** package is used to create small multiple line graph also known as trellis plot.



::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex07_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



### **7.4.2 Visual Analysis of Seasonality with Cycle Plot**

In the code chunk below, cycle plots using [`gg_subseries()`](https://feasts.tidyverts.org/reference/gg_subseries.html) of feasts package are created. Notice that the cycle plots show not only seasonal patterns but also trend.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tsibble_longer <- ts_tsibble %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = c(2:34),
               names_to = "Country",
               values_to = "Arrivals")
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tsibble_longer %>%
  filter(Country == "Vietnam" |
         Country == "Italy") %>% 
  gg_subseries(Arrivals)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex07_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## **7.5 Time series decomposition**

Time series decomposition allows us to isolate structural components such as trend and seasonality from the time-series data.

![](images/clipboard-2176589403.png){width="377"}

### **7.5.1 Single time series decomposition**



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tsibble_longer %>%
  filter(`Country` == "Vietnam") %>%
  ACF(Arrivals) %>% 
  autoplot()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex07_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



### **7.5.2 Multiple time-series decomposition**



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tsibble_longer %>%
  filter(`Country` == "Vietnam" |
         `Country` == "Italy" |
         `Country` == "United Kingdom" |
         `Country` == "China") %>%
  ACF(Arrivals) %>%
  autoplot()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex07_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## **7.7 Visual Forecasting**

### **7.7.1 Time Series Data Sampling**

First, an extra column called *Type* indicating training or hold-out will be created by using `mutate()` of **dplyr** package. It will be extremely useful for subsequent data visualisation.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
vietnam_ts <- tsibble_longer %>%
  filter(Country == "Vietnam") %>% 
  mutate(Type = if_else(
    `Month-Year` >= "2019-01-01", 
    "Hold-out", "Training"))
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
vietnam_train <- vietnam_ts %>%
  filter(`Month-Year` < "2019-01-01")
```
:::



### **7.7.2 Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): Time Series Data**



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
vietnam_train %>%
  model(stl = STL(Arrivals)) %>%
  components() %>%
  autoplot()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex07_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-19-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



### **7.7.8 Step 5: Forecasting future values**



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
fit_ETS <- vietnam_train %>%
  model(`SES` = ETS(Arrivals ~ error("A") + 
                      trend("N") + 
                      season("N")),
        `Holt`= ETS(Arrivals ~ error("A") +
                      trend("A") +
                      season("N")),
        `damped Holt` = 
          ETS(Arrivals ~ error("A") +
                trend("Ad") + 
                season("N")),
        `WH_A` = ETS(
          Arrivals ~ error("A") + 
            trend("A") + 
            season("A")),
        `WH_M` = ETS(Arrivals ~ error("M") 
                         + trend("A") 
                         + season("M"))
  )
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
fit_ETS %>%
  tidy()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 45 × 4
   Country .model      term      estimate
   <chr>   <chr>       <chr>        <dbl>
 1 Vietnam SES         alpha     1.00    
 2 Vietnam SES         l[0]  10313.      
 3 Vietnam Holt        alpha     1.00    
 4 Vietnam Holt        beta      0.000100
 5 Vietnam Holt        l[0]  13673.      
 6 Vietnam Holt        b[0]    526.      
 7 Vietnam damped Holt alpha     1.00    
 8 Vietnam damped Holt beta      0.000110
 9 Vietnam damped Holt phi       0.978   
10 Vietnam damped Holt l[0]  13257.      
# ℹ 35 more rows
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
fit_ETS %>%
  report()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 5 × 10
  Country .model       sigma2 log_lik   AIC  AICc   BIC       MSE   AMSE     MAE
  <chr>   <chr>         <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>
1 Vietnam SES         2.79e+7  -1453. 2912. 2912. 2920. 27515844. 5.99e7 3.91e+3
2 Vietnam Holt        2.86e+7  -1453. 2917. 2917. 2931. 27718599. 6.03e7 3.92e+3
3 Vietnam damped Holt 2.86e+7  -1453. 2918. 2919. 2935. 27556629. 5.97e7 3.92e+3
4 Vietnam WH_A        5.33e+6  -1336. 2706. 2711. 2755.  4684271. 8.56e6 1.72e+3
5 Vietnam WH_M        4.55e-3  -1300. 2635. 2640. 2684.  3046059. 3.42e6 5.20e-2
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
fit_ETS %>%
  forecast(h = "12 months") %>%
  autoplot(vietnam_ts, 
           level = NULL)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex07_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-23-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



### **7.7.9 Fitting ETS Automatically**



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
fit_autoETS <- vietnam_train %>%
  model(ETS(Arrivals))
fit_autoETS %>% report()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Series: Arrivals 
Model: ETS(M,A,M) 
  Smoothing parameters:
    alpha = 0.1613503 
    beta  = 0.0001021811 
    gamma = 0.0001030996 

  Initial states:
     l[0]     b[0]      s[0]     s[-1]     s[-2]     s[-3]    s[-4]    s[-5]
 15001.12 212.3552 0.9167302 0.8311728 0.8739287 0.8690543 1.104668 1.485584
    s[-6]     s[-7]    s[-8]     s[-9]    s[-10]    s[-11]
 1.311207 0.9917759 1.014187 0.8973028 0.8816768 0.8227129

  sigma^2:  0.0046

     AIC     AICc      BIC 
2634.751 2640.119 2683.759 
```


:::
:::



### **7.7.10 Fitting Fitting ETS Automatically**



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
gg_tsresiduals(fit_autoETS)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex07_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-25-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
